result.execSummary:
The defendant Leander J Hearvey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  *Court sets restitution at zero.

Provide a  DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leander J Hearvey in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Leander J Hearvey in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court is advised that there is no request for restitution and no victim impact statements have been submitted.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 25 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to 14CF5079.  CONFINEMENT of 20 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  Court sets restitution at ZERO.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Appeal rights filed in 14CF5079; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence filed

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Leander J Hearvey not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is requesting that the sentencing be adjourned to allow the PSI writer time to interview the defendant for the current PSI; the information contained in the PSI is from prior reports and dated.  The state has no objection to an adjournment.  The court will adjourn sentencing and directs that the PSI writer interview the defendant and submit an addendum to the court prior to the next date of 7-29-2015.
Clerk will email Patty Beyer-Robinson and inform of the court's order.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

To the amended information:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Defendant advised he must register as a sex offender and may be subject to Chapter 980 filing.Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility. 
Court orders a PSI without a recommendation and remands the defendant pending sentencing on 7-14-2015.

Defendant Leander J Hearvey in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Leander J Hearvey in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed by the state: Second Degree Sexual Assault, a class C felony. 940.225.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Leander J Hearvey not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsels believe they have resolved this matter short of trial and are requesting a plea date on 6-1-2015.

Defendant Leander J Hearvey in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Leander J Hearvey in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State's Motion for Joinder and defense response in opposition have been reviewed by the court.
Arguments by counsels.  Pursuant to 971.12 the court will order the joinder of cases 14CF5079 and 15CF491; the probative value outweighs prejudice to the defendant.
Defense Opposition to State's Joinder Motion received and filed.
State's Motion for Joinder with 14CF5079 received and filed.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Leander J Hearvey not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  All available discovery has been provided to defense.  Additional discovery will be provided upon receipt by the state.  State will be seeking joinder of cases. (14CF5079 and 15CF491).
Motion for Joinder to be heard on 4-6-2015 at 8:15am.
Case set for final pretrial on 5-21-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-15-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-18-2015.

Defendant Leander J Hearvey in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Leander J Hearvey in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KT; Union Cemetary and not contact with any child under 17.

Defendant Leander J Hearvey in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Leander J Hearvey in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
